title: Catherine de Parthenay
summary: Catherine de Parthenay (22 March 1554 – 26 October 1631) was a French noblewoman and mathematician.[1]   She studied with mathematician François Viète and was considered one of the most brilliant women of the era.  She married Charles de Quelennec, and after his death married René II, Viscount of Rohan, a Huguenot.[2]
